data.title: Need a way to test in-product release notes with insiders and vnext content
data.body:
Right now we can only view the previous version release notes following the steps in test plan https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12520 since the vnext release notes aren't available on code.visualstudio.com/raw.
While the Markdown preview of the vnext release notes is close to the actual release notes display, it is not exactly the same (for example, OS specific key board short cuts are resolved) and the two displays may diverge more in the future.
Can we point insiders to vscode-vnext.azurewebsites.net/raw? I'm not sure if non-Microsoft accounts will have access but for our own testing this should work.

data.title: Remove incorrect ANSI escape code for LF
data.body:
ANSI technically doesn't have an escape code for LF, since it just uses the 0x0A character. The regex `\xA` is incorrect (it should be `\x0A`) and is being treated as the two-character sequence `"xA"`. But then once we've fixed that, replacing 0x0A with \n in `removeAnsiEscapeCodes` is a no-op. Better to just remove the `str.replace(LF, '\n')` call.

Fixes #12608.

data.title: October Iteration Plan
data.body:
This plan captures what we work on during October. We will ship **early November**.

## Endgame Schedule
- _October, 24th_ Code freeze for the endgame
- _October, 30th_ Endgame done

##### Verification
- [x] Verification ([wiki](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Issue-Tracking#verification)): since there are quite some old bugs to verify we verify by age, youngest first. The queries are:
  - [x] [Verification needed](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+label%3Averification-needed)
  - [x] [October Bugs](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue%20label%3Abug%20-label%3Averified%20is%3Aclosed%20-label%3Aduplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20closed%3A%3E%3D2016-10-01%20-label%3Aas-designed)

##### Monday
- [x] Code freeze at 5pm PT
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms
- [x] All test items contain sufficiently comprehensive test descriptions by 6pm PT

##### Tuesday
- [x] Test build starts at 7am CET / 10pm PT on Monday
- [x] Test plan ready by 8am CET / 11pm PT on Monday
- [x] Testing

##### Wednesday
- [x] Testing
- [x] Remind team members to assign issues that they intend to fix to the October milestone
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
- [x] Verification (queries above)

##### Thursday
- [x] Fixing (scrutiny sets in - major bugs only - to be discussed in stand-up meeting, labeled as `candidate`)
- [x] Verification (queries above)
- [x] Add/update shrink-wrap files for built-in extensions if needed (see [instructions](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8570#issuecomment-229669456))
- [x] Update `OSSREADME.json` for built-in extensions based on differences to generated `npm-shrinkwrap.json` files if **@basero**
- [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-distro/blob/master/distro-tools/README.md) after merging shrink-wrap findings **@bpasero**
  - _The LCA review of the ThirdPartyNotices.txt files is not needed anymore_
- [x] Check new OSS usage is entered into the [OSS registry](https://ossmsft.visualstudio.com/_apps/hub/ms.vss-oss-web.hub-oss) **@bpasero**

##### Friday
- Satellite modules/npm packages ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] vscode **@jrieken**
  - [x] yo generator **@aeschli**
  - [x] vsce **@joaomoreno**
  - [x] node debug **@weinand**
  - [x] node debug2 **@roblourens**
- [x] Translation input - **@dbaeumer**
- [x] Verification (queries above)
- [x] Fixing (only critical bugs - no string changes)
- [x] All release notes updated. Release notes are collected in a file named _`1_7.md`_ in this [repo directory](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/release-notes/)
  - [x] @alexandrudima
  - [x] @weinand
  - [x] @bpasero 
  - [x] @chrmarti
  - [x] @tyriar
  - [x] @dbaeumer
  - [x] @egamma
  - [x] @isidorn 
  - [x] @joaomoreno
  - [x] @jrieken
  - [x] @kieferrm 
  - [x] @aeschli
  - [x] @rebornix
  - [x] @octref
  - [x] @ramya-rao-a
  - [x] @roblourens
  - [x] @sandy081
- [x] Acknowledge pull requests in release notes. We acknowledge PRs from outside the team. 
  Use the [thankyou](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-tools/tree/master/thankyou) utility to create the initial version @bpasero
  - [x] @alexandrudima
  - [x] @weinand
  - [x] @bpasero 
  - [x] @chrmarti
  - [x] @tyriar
  - [x] @dbaeumer
  - [x] @egamma
  - [x] @isidorn 
  - [x] @joaomoreno
  - [x] @jrieken
  - [x] @kieferrm 
  - [x] @aeschli
  - [x] @rebornix
  - [x] @octref
  - [x] @ramya-rao-a
  - [x] @roblourens
  - [x] @sandy081
- [x] Mention notable fixes in the release notes:
  - [x] @alexandrudima
  - [x] @weinand
  - [x] @bpasero 
  - [x] @chrmarti
  - [x] @tyriar
  - [x] @dbaeumer
  - [x] @egamma
  - [x] @isidorn 
  - [x] @joaomoreno
  - [x] @jrieken
  - [x] @kieferrm 
  - [x] @aeschli
  - [x] @rebornix
  - [x] @octref
  - [x] @ramya-rao-a
  - [x] @roblourens
  - [x] @sandy081
- [Smoketest](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Smoke-Test)
  - [x] Windows - **@bpasero**
  - [x] OS X - **@isidorn**
  - [x] Linux - **@joaomoreno**

##### Friday/Monday
- When done fixing/verifying and there are changes since last build at the end of day PT
  - [x] Trigger new insider build and publish it manually **@bpasero**
- [x] Pause scheduled `insider` builds **@bpasero**
- [x] Branch code to `release/<x.y> **@bpasero**
- [x] Announce master is open for business **@bpasero**
- [x] Polish release notes **@gregvanl**

##### Wednesday
- [x] Publish `Insider` with hand-picked and reviewed candidate fixes **@bpasero**
- [Smoketest](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Smoke-Test)
  - [x] Windows - **@chmarti**
  - [x] OS X - **@roblourens**
  - [x] Linux - **@tyriar**

##### Thursday/Monday
- [x] Build stable for all platforms **@bpasero**
- [x] Sanity check of installable bits
  - [x] Windows
    - [x] signed installer **@bpasero**
    - [x] zip **@bpasero**
  - [x] OS X - **@bpasero**
  - [x] Linux
    - [x] deb package 32-bit **@tyriar**
    - [x] deb package 64-bit **@bpasero**
    - [x] rpm package 64-bit **@tyriar**
    - [x] rpm package 32-bit **@tyriar**
    - [x] archives **@bpasero**
- [x] Publish website **@gregvanl**
- [x] Release [stable](https://vscode-builds.azurewebsites.net/stable) **@bpasero**
- [x] Add a git tag to `HEAD` of `release/1.7` in format `1.7.z` **@bpasero**
- [x] Twitter announcement **@chrisdias**
- [x] Enable scheduled `insider` builds **@bpasero**

## Plan Items

We are now using the new [Project](https://github.com/blog/2256-a-whole-new-github-universe-announcing-new-tools-forums-and-features) support to track the work planned for [October](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/projects/2).

The columns in the project mean:
- `Backlog` - the backlog for the iteration
- `Planned to Start Current week` - the work planned to start in the current week of the iteration
- `In Progress` - the item is actively being worked on
- `Done` - the work item is done and there is a corresponding test plan item.

data.title: Syntax highlighting broken in hover widget
data.body:
Syntax highlighting inside the hover widget seems to work differently compared to the highlighting inside the code editor.

Here's an example of how a Pascal function is shown in the editor with the OmniPascal plugin installed:

![correct](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3448684/19184429/62d79e3a-8c7d-11e6-968c-81c8078ae782.png)

The hover widget displays the same code with different colors:

In version 1.5.3:
![wrong_stable](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3448684/19184469/95abb13e-8c7d-11e6-8458-db53edb926ea.png)

In version 1.6.0-insiders:
![wrong_insiders](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3448684/19184482/a23c40e4-8c7d-11e6-97c6-693636c91343.png)

As you can see there are different colors used in the parameter list. That's just one of many examples where highlighting is inconsistent.

I'm the developer of OmniPascal, so I'd like to know whether this is can be a bug within my plugin or not? Or is it a bug in VSCode? When it's my fault: Do you have any ideas what might be wrong?

data.title: Make sidebar position a real setting
data.body: If a user decides to put the sidebar to the right, it is likely not a temporary decision but should be persisted into settings.

data.title: Allowing richer integration with integrated terminal (co-processes)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Popular terminal emulators such as iTerm2 and ConEmu allow for user defined interaction with the content being displayed. For instance there are [coprocesses](https://www.iterm2.com/documentation-coprocesses.html) and [triggers](https://www.iterm2.com/documentation/2.1/documentation-triggers.html) in iTerm2 which allow for very powerful interactions. For instance I have a coprocess that automagically make diagnostics in VS Code when running `tsc -w` in iTerm2. 

I think VS Code would greatly benefit from such rich interaction capabilities between the terminal and the outside-world

data.title: Debugger throws when debugging code which references a source map but the map file is missing.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0-insider
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. install vscode-jsonrpc@^3.0.0-alpha.1
2. install @type/node
3. create tsconfig.json

``` json
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "module": "commonjs",
        "sourceMap": true
    }
}
```
1. create app.ts

``` ts
import * as rpc from 'vscode-jsonrpc';

let logger: rpc.Logger  = {
    error: (message) => {},
    info: (message) => {},
    warn: (message) => {},
    log: (message) => {}
}

let connection = rpc.createMessageConnection(process.stdin, process.stdout, logger);
```
1. compile using tsc. ignore the compile errors. Not relevant for the problem
2. create launch.json and ENABLE source maps
3. set breakpoint in app.ts
4. debug
5. try to step into createMessageConnection

You get (see the exception on the call stack). I am pretty sure that before the debugger simply stepped into the JS code.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/19184058/95424fe8-8c7b-11e6-883c-26a167d1ff55.png)

data.title: Write window zoom configuration to settings
data.body: Instead of keeping the zoom level in memory and you loose it after restart, we should leverage the new configuration editing service and write those settings into the file.

data.title: Add automatic proxy configuration support in windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows

Please add the ability to support proxy.pac proxy support.  
For example in browsers this is as easy as selecting this proxy automatic connection type and then adding the path of the proxy.pac file.

Perhaps this is helpful.
https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/ieinternals/2013/10/11/understanding-web-proxy-configuration/

data.title: Many keys are broken on linux, making the editor practically unusable
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  Version 1.5.3
  Commit 5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27
  Date 2016-09-22T08:40:08.699Z
  Shell 0.37.6
  Renderer 49.0.2623.75
  Node 5.10.0
- OS Version:
  Ubuntu 16.04.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file in the editor.
2. Move the cursor away from the beginning of the file.
3. Attempt to use the left arrow key to move the cursor left or attempt to use the DEL button to delete something, or page up, page down, backspace, spacebar, etc.

This egregious lack of keyboard functionality must be some issue with my environment or something. How in the world can I troubleshoot this to fix it? All of the keys work normally in every other program on my system. They even work properly in Code inside the Developer Tools window, and in other parts of the program like Explorer, but not in the editor.

data.title: Enable more than one window on the same workspace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- give the user the option to open more than one window on the same workspace, but avoid that the user does this by accident when they forgot that they already have a windows open.
- provide an API so that the debugger can do this programmatically

data.title: Review actions that should persist their state into settings
data.body:
- [x] zoom - setting
- [x] sidebar location - setting
- [x] status bar visibility - setting
- toggle whitespace - not a setting
- toggle wordwrap - not a setting
- toggle control charactes - not a setting

data.title: JSON property value IntelliSense
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Create a tsconfig.json file
2.  Add "compilerOptions", then "target"

The tooltip over "target" says: Permitted values are 'es3', 'es5', or 'es2015'.
It would be much better to just provide those 3 values as candidates of completion. Use IntelliSense hotkey Ctrl+Space only show the default value, still doesn't provide completion candidates.

```
internal/process/next_tick.js:103 GET file:///Users/pzuraq/.vscode/extensions/pzuraq.theme-oceanic-reef-0.0.1/preview.png net::ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND_tickCallback @ internal/process/next_tick.js:103
```

Steps to Reproduce:
1. press cmd+p
2. type a search value and wait

data.title: Error in debugging ->  Security context: 0000016C78CC9FC9 <JS Object>#0#
TypeScript: Importing file from parent directory ("../") causes invalid autocomplete
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Linux Mint 17.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a TypeScript file
2. Type `import {} from ".`
3. Type `.` again

**Expected:**
I can import modules from a parent directory with no hassle.

**Actual:**
It is filled in automatically to be come `import {} from ".tslint.`, with "tslint" possibly replaced by some other package that happens to be in my `package.json`.

data.title: Add scrolling to integrated terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Arch Linux

Please add scrolling to integrated terminal, because if i have many errors (i am bad at cpp) i need to stretch terminal upwards to see all output, which sometimes goes way far, so i cant see anything. 
Same situation when running console apps.
I cant check if it is zsh making a problem, but if it is, then fix it please too.

Steps to Reproduce:
0. Open integrated terminal;
1. Compile something with huge amount of errors, or print something;
2. Notice that you can't scroll in integrated terminal.
3. Cry.

![screenshot from 2016-10-07 01-58-14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19470159/19173651/8726b830-8c31-11e6-91fa-37fd7dbaff50.png)
